H0.text: Completing its life cycle is the process exemplified by the leaves of a tree changing color in the fall.

H1.text: Preparing for migration is an example of a tree whose leaves change color in the fall.

H2.text: Responding to its environment is what a tree does when its leaves change color in the fall.

H3.text: Beginning hibernation is a process observed in a tree whose leaves change color in the fall.

A4.text: By shielding the leaf with anthocyanins, according to photoprotection theory, the tree manages to reabsorb nutrients (especially nitrogen) more efficiently.

A5.text: According to the coevolution theory, the colors are warning signals to insects like aphids that use trees as a host for the winter.
